events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
After initial review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the incident described.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to oversee the progression and communication with the claimant.
The insurance provider sent an acknowledgment to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Documents including police report, pictures of the damaged vehicle, and driver’s license were requested from the claimant.
The claimant provided the requested documents to assist with claim investigation and verify the details of the collision.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to establish fault and damages.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and determined the extent of damages to the vehicle.
A settlement offer was sent to the claimant based on the repair estimates and policy coverage limits.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and requested expedited processing of the payment.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department following acceptance of the settlement terms by the claimant.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the claimant’s designated account to cover vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that the claimant received payment and completed repairs.
The case file was archived for record keeping and future reference in accordance with company policy.
